summary: Peter: I have never been under as much stress as I am currently under now. I feel awful. My battery is running low and it’s...
body:
Peter: I have never been under as much stress as I am currently under now. I feel awful. My battery is running low and it’s getting dark.

Tony: Stop.

summary: Gwyneth Paltrow To Leave The MCU After “Avengers: Endgame”
title: Gwyneth Paltrow To Leave The MCU After “Avengers: Endgame”
body:
The Marvel Cinematic Universe will allegedly be losing its Pepper Potts after Avengers: Endgame. Actress Gwyneth Paltrow, who has played the Pepper since the first Iron Man film, will be retiring the role.

During an interview with Variety, Paltrow announced her official retirement from the MCU, saying that she was glad that she took on the role more than a decade ago.

“I mean, I’m a bit old to be…

View On WordPress

title: Roots
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2T2eEdx

by d_aia

The idea behind the Accords was not going to be ignored forever. They were the result of people desperate to stop the train coming and so they redirected where it could do the most good: the heroes, like any other kind of law enforcement entity, were to be held accountable for their actions. However, the Captain was right about one thing—even while missing the point that everybody was actually talking about—the world did end up needing them and so exceptions were made.

But the soaring point, the one that went so far over the Captain’s head that he didn’t even know it was there, was that the world would never come as hard on its heroes as it would on regular citizens.
*
Harley’s not a happy camper.

Words: 5555, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 1 of Tree

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Iron Man (Movies)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply

  • Relationships: Harley Keener & Tony Stark, Harley Keener & Peter Parker, Harley Keener & Pepper Potts, Loki/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Not Steve Rogers Friendly, Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, Canon Divergence - Avengers: Endgame

summary: What I will never understand is how antis are criticizing Tony because SI WERE making weapons and calling him war profiteer...
body: What I will never understand is how antis are criticizing Tony because SI WERE making weapons and calling him war profiteer while being fans of other Marvel characters like Cap or Bucky or almost like anyone from Marvel…This for me is hypocritical…I mean all the others are soldiers, agents and they are fighting surprisingly with weapons not with flowers and somebody needs to create these weapons for them. I just don’t get the logic (Nothing against Steve or Bucky though)

title: Spiders don’t stick through shoes
body:
Though it is never really adressed anywhere (comics, movies, cartoons, etc), I can’t imagine that Peter’s stickiness can go through the thick soles of his shoes. 

Can we just entertain, for a minute, the exasperation, fondness, joy, worry and every other emotion Tony goes through every time Peter loses his shoes because he had to spiderman somewhere and just kicked them off like they were annoying inconveniences? 

Exasperation because: Really Pete? That’s like the third pair this week!


Fondness because: Well, I couln’t leave this little guy (insert puppy or kitten) all the way up on that niche. Someone must have thrown him up there, like who even does that? Thats so cruel! He couln’t get down from there by himself. He would have died.


Joy because: Well, it’s about the only thing Peter let’s him buy for him without too much: “But Mr. Stark, you don’t have to spend all that money for me. I can make do.”…- just as long as Peter never finds out how much the shoes Tony gets him cost.


Worry because: Good Lord Peter! Were you running over broken glass or something?! Your feet are ripped open everywhere! - “Sorry Mr. Stark, I didn’t mean to get your floor all bloody. I swear I will clean it up.” - THAT’S NOT WHAT I’M WORRIED ABOUT!

And so on.
Could be used as fodder for both a platonic father son relationship between the two, as well as a romantic relationship (with aged up Peter and aged down Tony, I don’t like too big age gaps)
